Package model

Class SoccerGame

java.lang.Object
model.SoccerGame
public class SoccerGame extends Object
The SoccerGame class represents the key functionality of our Mini-Soccer Game and the implementation of this class is what allows for the game as well as the roles of the players to function as intended.
Author:
Roberto Shino, Arian Mohamad Hosaini, Wenjing Qu

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    SoccerGame()
    Creates the SoccerGame with the set attributes that every SoccerGame should start with.

    • getTimeRemaining

      public Integer getTimeRemaining()
      Gets the time remaining in the soccer game.
      Returns:
      Integer the time remaining in the game

    • setTimeRemaining

      public void setTimeRemaining(Integer timeRemaining)
      Sets the time remaining in the soccer game to the given time.
      Parameters:
      timeRemaining - the new time which the game's time will be set to

    • getGoal

      public Integer getGoal()
      Gets the number of goals which have been scored.
      Returns:
      Integer the number of goals

    • setGoal

      public void setGoal(Integer newGoal)
      Sets the number of goals which have been scored to the given value.
      Parameters:
      newGoal - the desired number of goals which to set the goals to

    • isPaused

      public Boolean isPaused()
      Determines whether the game is currently paused.
      Returns:
      true if the game is paused false if the game is not paused

    • setPaused

      public void setPaused(Boolean paused)
      Sets the game to pause or unpause status depending on the given boolean value.
      Parameters:
      paused - the value which determines if the game will be paused or not

    • isOver

      public Boolean isOver()
      Tells us whether or not the game is over.
      Returns:
      true if the game is over false if the game is not over

    • setOver

      public void setOver(Boolean over)
      Sets the game to over or restarts the game based based on the given boolean value.
      Parameters:
      over - the given boolean which determines whether the game is over or restarting

    • getGamePlayers

      public PlayerCollection getGamePlayers()
      Gets the collection of the players.
      Returns:
      PlayerCollection the collection of the players

    • automateGoalkeeper

      public void automateGoalkeeper()
      Determines what the goalkeeper in the game is doing. If there is no ball he/she can save, he/she will continue moving side to side randomly. If there is a ball he/she can save, he/she will save it.

    • isScored

      public boolean isScored()
      Determines whether the soccer ball has been scored. It is scored when it is in the net.
      Returns:
      true if the ball is scored false if the ball has not been scored

    • getActivePlayer

      public GamePlayer getActivePlayer()
      Gets the striker from the collection.
      Returns:
      GamePlayer the striker
